a member of the British Conservative Party: Margaret Thatcher was elected to lead the Tories in 1975.
a member of the main conservative political party in Canada: Liberal Martha Hall Findlay accused the Tories of keeping Canadians in the dark about the costs.
US a person who supported the British government during the American Revolution: During the American Revolution, the Tories were bitterly denounced.
More examplesFewer examplesThere are five Tories in the group.One source said that most of the seats up for grabs this year are in urban areas, where the Tories are still struggling to make an impact. belonging to, supporting, or relating to the British Conservative Party: They are both Tory voters living in Cornwall. There was a Tory government in Britain throughout the 1980s.
belonging to, supporting, or relating to the main conservative political party in Canada: With 24 Tory MPs from Ontario, his party now had a credible national voice.
US supporting the British government during the American Revolution: Bristol, Connecticut was a hotbed of Tory activity during the Revolution.
